C.what is c language: C is a high-level, general-purpose programming language developed by Dennis Ritchie in 1972, widely used for system programming and embedded systems.
C.what is c compiler: A C compiler translates C source code into machine code or object code that can be executed by the computer.
C.what is c preprocessor: The C preprocessor processes directives like #include, #define, and #ifdef before compilation.
C.what is c header file: Header files (.h) contain declarations for functions and macros that can be shared across multiple source files.
C.what is c variable: A variable is a named storage location in memory that holds data of a specific type.
C.what are c data types: C data types include int, float, double, char, void, and derived types like arrays, pointers, and structures.
C.what is c constant: A constant is a value that cannot be changed during program execution, declared using const or #define.
C.what is c operator: Operators perform operations on variables and values, including arithmetic, relational, logical, bitwise, and assignment operators.
C.what is c expression: An expression combines variables, constants, and operators to produce a value.
C.what is c statement: A statement is a single instruction executed by the program, like assignments, function calls, or loops.
C.what is c function: A function is a block of code that performs a specific task and can be called from other parts of the program.
C.what is c main function: Main() is the entry point of a C program, where execution begins.
C.what is c return statement: Return statement exits a function and optionally returns a value to the caller.
C.what is c parameter: A parameter is a variable declared in a function definition to accept input values from the caller.
C.what is c argument: An argument is a value passed to a function when it is called.
C.what is c scope: Scope determines where a variable is accessible in the program: local, global, or block scope.
C.what is c storage class: Storage classes (auto, register, static, extern) define the lifetime, scope, and visibility of variables.
C.what is c pointer: A pointer is a variable that stores the memory address of another variable.
C.what is c dereferencing: Dereferencing a pointer accesses or modifies the value stored at the memory address it points to.
C.what is c null pointer: A null pointer points to no valid memory location, represented by NULL.
C.what is c pointer arithmetic: Pointer arithmetic allows adding or subtracting integers to move through memory addresses of arrays.
C.what is c array: An array is a collection of elements of the same type stored in contiguous memory locations.
C.what is c string: A string is an array of characters terminated by a null character '\0'.
C.what is c multidimensional array: Multidimensional arrays store data in rows and columns, commonly used for matrices and tables.
C.what is c structure: A structure groups variables of different types under a single name for better organization.
C.what is c union: A union stores different data types in the same memory location, but only one member can hold a value at a time.
C.what is c enum: An enumeration defines a set of named integer constants for better code readability.
C.what is c typedef: Typedef creates an alias name for existing data types or structures.
C.what is c macro: Macros are preprocessor directives that define constants or code snippets replaced before compilation.
C.what is c #include: #Include inserts the contents of a header file or library into the source code during preprocessing.
C.what is c #define: #Define creates symbolic constants or macros to simplify code.
C.what is c #ifdef: #Ifdef checks if a macro is defined before including certain code blocks.
C.what is c if statement: If statement executes a block of code only if a specified condition is true.
C.what is c else statement: Else statement executes a block of code when the if condition is false.
C.what is c else if statement: Else if allows multiple conditional checks sequentially after an if statement.
C.what is c switch statement: Switch executes one block of code among many based on the value of an expression.
C.what is c break statement: Break exits the nearest enclosing loop or switch statement immediately.
C.what is c continue statement: Continue skips the current iteration of a loop and moves to the next iteration.
C.what is c goto statement: Goto transfers control unconditionally to a labeled statement, generally discouraged.
C.what is c for loop: For loop executes a block of code a fixed number of times using an index variable.
C.what is c while loop: While loop executes a block of code repeatedly as long as a condition remains true.
C.what is c do while loop: Do-while loop executes a block of code at least once and continues while the condition is true.
C.what is c recursion: Recursion is when a function calls itself directly or indirectly to solve a problem.
C.what is c call by value: Call by value passes a copy of the variable to a function, leaving the original unchanged.
C.what is c call by reference: Call by reference passes the memory address of a variable to a function, allowing modifications.
C.what is c dynamic memory allocation: Dynamic memory allocation uses malloc(), calloc(), realloc(), and free() to allocate and free memory at runtime.
C.what is c malloc: Malloc allocates a specified number of bytes and returns a pointer to the allocated memory.
C.what is c calloc: Calloc allocates memory for multiple elements and initializes them to zero.
C.what is c realloc: Realloc resizes previously allocated memory blocks to a new size.
C.what is c free: Free releases dynamically allocated memory back to the system.
C.what is c file handling: C file handling allows reading, writing, and manipulating files using fopen(), fclose(), fread(), fwrite(), fprintf(), fscanf(), and fseek().
C.what is c fopen: Fopen opens a file in a specified mode (read, write, append) and returns a file pointer.
C.what is c fclose: Fclose closes an opened file, freeing associated resources.
C.what is c fread: Fread reads data from a file into memory buffer.
C.what is c fwrite: Fwrite writes data from memory buffer to a file.
C.what is c fprintf: Fprintf writes formatted data to a file similar to printf.
C.what is c fscanf: Fscanf reads formatted data from a file similar to scanf.
C.what is c fseek: Fseek moves the file pointer to a specified location in a file.
C.what is c ftell: Ftell returns the current position of the file pointer in bytes from the beginning.
C.what is c rewind: Rewind moves the file pointer back to the beginning of a file.
C.what is c binary file: Binary files store data in binary format for efficient storage and retrieval, unlike text files.
C.what is c pointer to function: Pointer to function stores the address of a function and allows calling the function indirectly.
C.what is c command line arguments: Command line arguments allow passing inputs to a program via the command line during execution.
C.what is c preprocessor directive: Preprocessor directives are instructions processed before compilation, including #include, #define, #ifdef, #ifndef.
C.what is c memory layout: C program memory layout includes stack (local variables), heap (dynamic memory), data segment (global/static variables), and code segment (instructions).
C.what is c segmentation fault: Segmentation fault occurs when a program accesses invalid memory, like dereferencing null or out-of-bounds pointers.
C.what is c buffer overflow: Buffer overflow happens when writing beyond allocated memory, potentially causing crashes or security issues.
C.what is c pointer vs array: Pointers store addresses and can traverse memory; arrays are fixed-size contiguous memory blocks.
C.what is c string vs char array: String is a sequence of characters ending with null character '\0'; char array may or may not be null-terminated.
C.what is c type casting: Type casting converts a variable from one data type to another, either implicitly or explicitly.
C.what is c const keyword: Const makes a variable value unmodifiable after initialization.
C.what is c volatile keyword: Volatile tells the compiler that a variable may change unexpectedly, preventing optimization.
C.what is c restrict keyword: Restrict informs the compiler that a pointer is the only reference to a memory location for optimization.
C.what is c inline keyword: Inline suggests the compiler replace function calls with function code to reduce overhead.
C.what is c static keyword: Static preserves the value of a variable between function calls or restricts visibility to the file.
C.what is c extern keyword: Extern declares variables or functions defined in another file or module.
C.what is c register keyword: Register suggests storing a variable in CPU register for faster access.
C.what is c typedef keyword: Typedef creates an alias for existing data types for readability.
C.what is c macro vs function: Macros are preprocessor substitutions, while functions are compiled code blocks with type checking.
C.what is c volatile pointer: A volatile pointer points to memory that may change unexpectedly, ensuring fresh reads from memory.
C.what is c segmentation vs paging: Segmentation divides memory into variable-length segments, paging divides memory into fixed-size pages.
C.what is c header guards: Header guards prevent multiple inclusions of a header file using #ifndef, #define, and #endif.
